page.title: 14M/V RHOUMA,RHUM _ OTHER USES
page.content:
In addition to its use as a ferryboat, the Rhouma is also used for other purposes.
On occasions, she is used for bird counts round the island cliffs, or to bring home deer shot by the stalkers on isolated stretches of the island.
There are times when she carries out missions of mercy, taking sick or injured persons to Mallaig, to go by ambulance from there to Fort William. She is also used for Coastguard search and rescue missions, or just to take people, or the Doctor, or Vet from one island to another.
So the Rhouma is the lifeline of this island, and is also a link in the chain of the Small Isles.
